author: S Prasad
text:
The Transport Department along with Traffic police on Monday conducted a special enforcement drive on the East Coast Road and surrounding areas as part of the Road Safety Week.

According to a senior Transport department official, teams led by the Traffic police and Motor Vehicle Inspectors conducted the drive at Kokku Park on the ECR to check for violation for permit conditions by commercial vehicles and those plying vehicles without proper insurance cover and other documents.

Around 30 notices were issued for violation of permit conditions and spot fine was levied by the Motor Vehicle Inspectors.

The Transport department has been regularly conducting enforcement drives and a sum of Rs. 60,000 realised as fine every week, he said. The Traffic police assisting the team of Motor Vehicle Inspectors also booked around 30 cases mostly two-wheelers and imposed fine for common violations. The Traffic police collected a sum of Rs.3,000 during the special enforcement drive.

An official said that notices were issued to those travelling without proper documents and license. The owners of the vehicles were asked to furnish their documents or to pay the fine imposed on them. The special drive was held to spread awareness among the people that stringent action would be taken against the violators of traffic rules, he said.

The Transport Department has organised an eye camp and special medical check up for drivers and conductors attached to the Government buses at the Regional Transport Office in Oulgaret on Tuesday as part of the 27{+t}{+h}Road Safety Week which began on January 10.
title: Notices issued to vehicles for violations
